intro: Cheilanthes notholaenoides, commonly known as the rock fern or false shield fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its compact, evergreen growth habit and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant produces small, clustered fronds with a leathery texture and dark green coloration. It is native to regions of South America, particularly Chile and Argentina, where it grows in dry, sunny environments. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in arid gardens.
